newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Cedel Bank 1996 operating profit rises.
newsitem.headline: Cedel Bank 1996 operating profit rises.

text.p: Luxembourg-based Cedel Bank, a supplier of clearing, settlement and custodial services, said in a statement operating income for the bank rose to $420.4 million in 1996.
Ordinary operating profit before tax and provisions was $45.7 million. It gave no comparative figures.
"The bank maintained a healthy liquidity ratio of 102.3 percent and a BIS solvency ratio of 17.6 percent," it added.
Cedel customer turnover increased 36 percent, exceeeding $13 trillion, and customer deposits grew 18 percent to over $1.2 trillion.
The group noted it had maintained its A1+ rating with IBCA Ltd and Standard and Poor's, and that it had been assigned a long term rating for the first time - AA+ from S&P, and AA from IBCA.
The bank said it further extended its global network of links during 1996, providing customers with access to Britain, Czech Republic, Indonesia and Hungary.
